author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and [Molldrem Family Dentistry](https://molldremdentistry.com/) caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. Treatment called 'inconceivable' “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote [Dr. Avrum Goldstein,](https://www.seakexperts.com/members/4827-avrum-r-goldstein) a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at [NOVA Southeastern University](https://dental.nova.edu/aboutus/faculty/goldstein-avrum%20.html?_gl=1*1kqtqxq*_gcl_au*ODA4NzUxNTA1LjE3MDM3OTc5MjI.), also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.” Doctors remove wrong organ from man: [They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.](/story/news/health/2023/11/07/doctors-accidentally-remove-wrong-organ-surgery/71487292007/) The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. “Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: La Opinión de A Coruña
title: El tiempo en Narón: previsión meteorológica para hoy, jueves 24 de julio
text:
El tiempo en Narón: previsión meteorológica para hoy, jueves 24 de julio
Esta es la predicción del tiempo para hoy en Narón según los datos de la AEMET
La Opinión de A Coruña
O 24 de xullo de 2025, Narón espertarase cun tempo maiormente despexado durante as primeiras horas do día. Ás 00:00 horas, a temperatura situarase en 17 graos , cunha humidade relativa do 76%, o que proporcionará unha sensación de frescura. A medida que avance a mañá, a temperatura manterase estable, alcanzando os 16 graos á 01:00 e 02:00 horas, con ceos pouco nubrados que permitirán gozar dun inicio de xornada agradable.
Con todo, a partir das 03:00 horas, o ceo comezará a nublarse, pasando a un estado nubrado que se manterá ata as 08:00 horas. Durante este período, a temperatura manterase ao redor dos 16 graos, cunha lixeira diminución na humidade relativa, que se espera que baixe ao 85% ás 02:00 horas. A partir das 09:00 horas, a temperatura comezará a aumentar, alcanzando os 17 graos, e o ceo manterase cuberto ata as 10:00 horas.
A medida que o día avanza, prevese un aumento na temperatura, que alcanzará os 19 graos ás 11:00 horas e os 20 graos ás 12:00 horas. A tarde será cálida, con temperaturas que chegarán aos 23 graos entre as 13:00 e as 15:00 horas. A humidade relativa seguirá diminuíndo, alcanzando un 54% ás 14:00 horas, o que contribuirá a unha sensación de calor máis intensa.
O vento soprará do nordés, con velocidades que oscilarán entre os 6 e 24 km/h ao longo do día. Os refachos máis fortes rexistraranse entre as 10:00 e as 15:00 horas, alcanzando ata 41 km/h. Isto podería xerar unha sensación de frescura, especialmente durante as horas máis cálidas.
En canto á probabilidade de precipitación, espérase que sexa nula durante todo o día, o que significa que non haberá choivas que interrompan as actividades ao aire libre. As condicións climáticas son ideais para gozar dun día na natureza ou realizar actividades ao aire libre, xa que non se prevén treboadas nin precipitacións.
A medida que o sol se poña ás 22:04 horas, a temperatura comezará a descender, alcanzando os 18 graos ás 23:00 horas. A noite presentarase despexada, o que permitirá gozar dun ceo estrelado e temperaturas agradables para finalizar o día.
Información elaborada utilizando, entre outras, a obtida da Axencia Estatal de Meteoroloxía. © AEMET. Data de actualización dos datos: 2025-07-23T20:57:12.

author: @ria
title: СМИ: Трампа заподозрили в деменции после неожиданного ответа на вопрос | Politics | Seldon News
text: МОСКВА, 3 июл — РИА Новости. Президента США Дональда Трампа заподозрили в деменции после его ответа на пресс-конференции, посвященной открытию центра содержания мигрантов "Аллигаторовый Алькатрас" во Флориде, пишет британский таблоид Daily Star . "Недавние высказывания Дональда Трампа вновь вызвали опасения по поводу его психического здоровья, поскольку он, по-видимому, назвал себя "заключенным" и заявил, что ему предстоит провести "много времени" в новой тюрьме "Аллигаторовый Алькатрас", — говорится в материале. Как уточняет издание, когда у Трампа спросили, как долго задержанные будут...

author: Katie Williams
title: East Lothian and Midlothian snow warning as Met Office warns of 'travel disruption' - Edinburgh Live
text: A new yellow [weather](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/all-about/weather) warning has been issued to parts of the Lothians as the Met Office warns of travel disruption. According to the Met Office, rain and snow could cause travel disruption across Scotland, including parts of Midlothian and [ East Lothian.](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/all-about/east-lothian) This comes just a day after the country was battered by Storm Gerrit which brought heavy rain and strong winds to Edinburgh. A clean-up operation is underway after train lines were closed, Cuper in Fife was hit by flooding, and 1,000s of homes were left without power. READ NEXT- [Moment mindless Edinburgh yobs tip van on its side after Hibs and Hearts derby](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/news/edinburgh-news/moment-mindless-edinburgh-yobs-tip-28362563) READ NEXT- [Edinburgh police swoop on busy street as officers spotted outside shops and homes](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/news/edinburgh-news/edinburgh-police-swoop-busy-street-28363568) In the latest update, the weather warning will come into force from 8am on Saturday and last until 3pm. Join [Edinburgh Live's Whatsapp Community here](https://chat.whatsapp.com/DBFongo3zQS6P8RfPA1ryO) and get the latest news sent straight to your messages. With temperatures dropping to -1C in the early hours of the morning, the weather forecasters warn that snow and wintry showers could hit parts of Midlothian and East Lothian. The weather forecasters add: "After a cold start widespread rain and hill snow will spread northeast, some sleet or snow down to low levels at first. Turning drier in the afternoon. Cold. Maximum temperature 4C." They also add that a period of sleet and snow, turning to rain on Saturday may lead to some flooding and travel disruption. Andy Page is a Met Office Chief Forecaster. He said: “Parts of the higher ground of Scotland may see temporary snow accumulations of 5-10cm, while up to 25mm of rain is expected in Wales, Northern Ireland and lower levels in Scotland. Across Wales and southern England wind gusts of 45-50mph are likely to be quite widespread, while gusts of 65-75mph are possible in the most exposed coastal areas.” Sign up for Edinburgh Live's newsletter Get all the latest news and headlines from Edinburgh, Fife and the Lothians sent straight to your inbox twice a day by signing up to our free newsletter. From [breaking news](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/news/) to the latest on the [coronavirus](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/all-about/coronavirus) crisis in Scotland, we'll have you covered. The morning newsletter arrives every day before 9am and the evening newsletter, manually curated by the team, is sent at 6.30pm, giving you a round up of the most important stories of the day. To sign up to any of our newsletters, visit this link [here](https://data.reachplc.com/223337010414946).
